channel.title: onionshare not connecting to TOR controller
channel.description:
Hi all, I am trying to get Onionshare running on Qubes Whonix for a while now. I Install it as it is explained in the docs. When I try to set the settings as written it says "Can't connect to the Tor controller using socket file /var/run/tor/control." Does anyone know what I might be doing wrong here.
Best regards

item.title: onionshare not connecting to TOR controller
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
OnionShare - Whonix updated. Works as is.

If OnionShare was installed from Debian package sources as documented on this wiki page, then no configuration changes specific to Whonix ™ in the OnionShare application are required. [11]

  • Installation using flatpak is discouraged because it leads to Tor over Tor.
  • Installation from Debian package sources as documented below is recommended.

[11] Under “How should OnionShare connect to Tor?” no changes are required. Even setting “Use the Tor version built into OnionShare” is OK in the very case of OnionShare and does not lead to Tor over Tor thanks to special support by anon-ws-disable-stacked-tor.https://github.com/Whonix/anon-ws-disable-stacked-tor/blob/master/usr/bin/tor.anondist#L70 [archive]

Actually all “How should OnionShare connect to Tor?" settings are functional when installed from Debian package sources.

Read full topic
item.source: onionshare not connecting to TOR controller

item.source: onionshare not connecting to TOR controller

item.title: onionshare not connecting to TOR controller
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Installed onionshare from Debian package sources.

Create some file.

touch a

Start onoinshare.

onionshare a

Works for me on the command line (GUI not tested yet). Shows the following error message but works for me nonetheless.

ERROR: ld.so: object ‘/usr/lib/libindp.so’ from LD_PRELOAD cannot be preloaded (cannot dynamically load position-independent executable): ignored.

Upstream bug report:

github.com/yongboy/bindp

ERROR: ld.so: object '/usr/lib/libindp.so' from LD_PRELOAD cannot be preloaded (cannot dynamically load position-independent executable): ignored.

opened 06:58PM - 15 Oct 21 UTC
adrelanos

> ERROR: ld.so: object '/usr/lib/libindp.so' from LD_PRELOAD cannot be preloaded… (cannot dynamically load position-independent executable): ignored. This is happening since Debian `bullseye`. Found this, same error message for a different library: * https://github.com/nixcloud/ip2unix/issues/9 * https://github.com/nixcloud/ip2unix/commit/8e10ef2d1d76ba8835735eaab167e77de34df88a

For reference:

github.com

GitHub - Whonix/bindp: Binding specific IP and Port for Linux Running...

Binding specific IP and Port for Linux Running Application - GitHub - Whonix/bindp: Binding specific IP and Port for Linux Running Application

github.com

GitHub - yongboy/bindp: Binding specific IP and Port fro Linux Running...

Binding specific IP and Port fro Linux Running Application - GitHub - yongboy/bindp: Binding specific IP and Port fro Linux Running Application

  • Search results for 'libindp' - Whonix Forum
  • Query: Advanced Search
  • Query: Advanced Search
  • Dev/anon-ws-disable-stacked-tor - Whonix

Read full topic
item.source: onionshare not connecting to TOR controller

item.title: onionshare not connecting to TOR controller
item.dc:creator: torjunkie
item.description:
v2.2 installed from Debian bullseye stable partially works.

This includes:

  • a network test with the recommended settings
  • receive mode also works

However, the UI hangs when trying to select files to share or when trying to publish a website.

That error probably relates to this? →

github.com/onionshare/onionshare

Application UI hangs

opened 06:39PM - 07 Sep 21 UTC
mmhy2003

I really love your application and its simple UI experience. But I am really an…noyed from GUI hanging whenever something is getting processed in the background. Like for example on the settings page, when I try to test the Tor connection, the interface totally freezes. I recommend separating UI & BG processing in different threads to avoid application interface freezing. Peace.

v2.4 runs the first time, but after that you get constant python errors upon launch i.e. useless.

Read full topic
item.source: onionshare not connecting to TOR controller
